    HaskellX 2016 Conference & Hackathon

    less than 1 minute read

    I just spent four days hanging with the (very international) Haskell community in London.

    First I attended the two-dayÂ Haskell eXchangeÂ conference.Â This was in fact my very first conference! I watched talks on a range of topics, ranging from notation for category theory to the use of Haskell for games and web development, and even got hands-on in aÂ workshop.Â Good fun! The highlights were of course the keynotes (I was left mind-blown byÂ this one). All theÂ videos are nowÂ available online.

    After that, there wasÂ HaskellXHack, a two-dayÂ hackathon focused on improving the Haskell infrastructure (Hackage, Cabal, etc.). I paired up with another developer to contribute to Hackage; we looked at a couple issues around rendering webpage content and raisedÂ pull requestsÂ to fix them.

    It was great seeing many friendly, familiar faces from Munich and Utrecht. Iâ€™ll definitely be back next year!
